IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES THEM FOR LIFE, SERVICE, AND SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS, CHAMINADE ENCOURAGES THE DEVELOPMENT OF MORAL CHARACTER, PERSONAL COMPETENCIES, AND A COMMITMENT TO BUILD A JUST AND PEACEFUL SOCIETY. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS BOTH THE CIVIC AND CHURCH COMMUNITIES OF THE PACIFIC REGION ITS ACADEMIC AND INTELLECTUAL RESOURCES IN THE PURSUIT OF COMMON AIMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES THEM FOR LIFE, WORK AND SERVICE. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS, CHAMINADE ENCOURAGES THE (SEE SCHEDULE O) DEVELOPMENT OF MORAL CHARACTER AND PERSONAL COMPETENCIES, AND THE COMMITMENT TO BUILD A JUST AND PEACEFUL SOCIETY. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS THE CIVIC AND CHURCH COMMUNITIES OF THE PACIFIC REGION ITS ACADEMIC AND INTELLECTUAL RESOURCES IN THE PURSUIT OF COMMON AIMS.
IRS990.Desc: CHAMINADE OFFERS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES STUDENTS FOR LIFE, SERVICE AND SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS AND ACCREDITED BY THE WASC SENIOR COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY COMMISSION, CHAMINADE PROVIDES 2200 STUDENTS WITH 25 UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS, NINE CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS, SIX GRADUATE PROGRAMS, THREE DOCTORAL PROGRAMS AND 15 DEGREE OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORKING ADULTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES AT CHAMINADE INCLUDE A 300 STUDENT RESIDENCE HALL PROGRAM; DINING SERVICES FEATURING THE SILVERSWORD CAFE AND COURTYARD POD MARKET; NCAA PACIFIC WEST CONFERENCE DIVISION II ATHLETIC PROGRAM ANNUALLY HOSTING THE MAUI JIM MAUI INVITATIONAL BASKETBALL TOURNAMENT; CAMPUS BOOKSTORE.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: INTEREST IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN FYE JUNE 30, 2011, THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED A FINE ART EDITION OF THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE. THE BIBLE IS A WORK OF ART AND A WORK OF THEOLOGY. THE VISION AND VALUES OF THE BIBLE ARE TO IGNITE IMAGINATION, GLORIFY GOD'S WORD, REVIVE TRADITION, DISCOVER HISTORY, FOSTER THE ARTS, AND GIVE VOICE. THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE, ON PUBLIC EXHIBITION, PROVIDES EDUCATION TO STUDENTS BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO EXPLORE THE VARIOUS SUBJECTS WRITTEN AND ILLUMINATED IN THE BIBLE. CHAMINADE PLANS TO USE THE BIBLE IN LITURGIES MARKING EVENTS OF GREATEST SIGNIFICANCE IN CAMPUS LIFE, SUCH AS GRADUATIONS AND INSTALLATIONS. CHAMINADE WILL ALSO MAKE IT AVAILABLE FOR USE BY THE DIOCESE OF HONOLULU FOR SIMILAR OCCASIONS, SUCH AS THE ANNUAL RED MASS FOR HAWAII'S POLITICAL LEADERS AND THE OPENING OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR MASS WITH THE CATHOLIC SCHOOL TEACHERS.
ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND PROGRAM EXPENSES.

IN EVALUATING A TAX POSITION FOR RECOGNITION, MANAGEMENT JUDGMENTALLY EVALUATES WHETHER IT IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THAT A TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION, INCLUDING RESOLUTION OF RELATED APPEALS OR LITIGATION PROCESSES, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. IF THE TAX POSITION MEETS THE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD, THE TAX POSITION IS MEASURED AND RECOGNIZED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT, IN MANAGEMENT'S JUDGMENT, IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2021 AND 2020. INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF ANY (NONE IN 2021 OR 2020), ARE INCLUDED IN INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT EXPENSES.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF 271,113.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 14,593,616. FEDERAL GRANTS 3,710,262. ROUNDING 7.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 14,593,616. FEDERAL GRANTS NETTED AGAINST REVENUE 3,710,262. ROUNDING 5.

PLEDGE RECEIVABLES THAT ARE EXPECTED TO BE COLLECTED IN FUTURE YEARS ARE RECORDED AT THE PRESENT VALUE OF THEIR ESTIMATED FUTURE CASH FLOWS USING RISK-FREE INTEREST RATES IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE PLEDGES ARE MADE. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2020, A RESTATEMENT OF AN EXISTING DISCOUNTED PLEDGE RECEIVABLE WAS IMPLEMENTED DUE TO AN EXTENSION OF THE AMORTIZATION PERIOD. AS A RESULT, THE FISCAL YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2019 AND 2018 INCLUDE A PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT AS REFLECTED IN LINES 1A THROUGH 1G.
NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY" IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, STUDENT HANDBOOK AND CHAMINADE WEBSITE (WWW.CHAMINADE.EDU)
THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GOVERNMENT GRANTS SUCH AS THE PELL GRANT, TEACH GRANT, AND SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: VP OF HR AND LEGAL AFFAIRS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION PAYS FOR HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES ON BEHALF OF PERSONS LISTED ON FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A. AMOUNTS PAID ARE TO FACILITATE BUSINESS ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY SUCH PERSONS AT THE CLUB. CLUB DUES ARE PAID ON BEHALF OF LYNN BABINGTON AND ROY PANZARELLA. AS ALL DUES PAID ARE TO FACILITATE BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, THE CLUB DUES QUALIFY AS WORKING CONDITION FRINGE BENEFITS AND ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION DOES NOT FOLLOW A WRITTEN POLICY SPECIFICALLY FOR HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES. HOWEVER, WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION IS REQUIRED FOR ALL CHARGES INCURRED ON THE MONTHLY DUES STATEMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, ALL REIMBURSEMENTS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CLUB.
QUESTIONS 4D-4E AND 5D ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BEEN MARKED NO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART I, BOND ISSUES:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE A INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING BOND CUSIPS: 419800GS0 419800GT8 419800GU5 419800GV3
QUESTIONS 7G AND 7H ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BEEN MARKED NO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHAMINADE'S MEMBERS CONSIST OF THE PROVINCIAL OF THE MARIANIST PROVINCE OF THE UNITED STATES, CHAMINADE CHAIR OF BOARD, THE PRESIDENT OF CHAMINADE AND THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PROVINCIAL COUNCIL OF THE MARIANIST PROVINCE OF THE UNITED STATES. THE MEMBERS HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE'S GOVERNING BODY AND APPROVE SIGNIFICANT DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY, AMONG OTHER SIMILAR POWERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE POSITION OF PRESIDENT OF CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OF HONOLULU AND TO RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE BOARD OF REGENTS AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE ELECTION OF REGENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO: (A) APPROVE THE MERGER OR CONSOLIDATION OF CHAMINADE WITH ANOTHER CORPORATION OR ENTITY; (B) APPROVE THE SALE, LEASE, EXCHANGE, OR OTHER DISPOSITION OF ALL, OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL, OF THE ASSETS OF CHAMINADE, OTHER THAN IN THE USUAL AND REGULAR COURSE OF ITS BUSINESS; (C) APPROVE THE PARTIAL OR TOTAL DISSOLUTION OF CHAMINADE; (D) AMEND CHAMINADE'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION PURSUANT TO THE PROCEDURES SET FORTH BY STATUTE; (E) RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE POSITION OF PRESIDENT OF CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OF HONOLULU; (F) RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE BOARD OF REGENTS OF CHAMINADE AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE ELECTION OF REGENTS; AND (G) REMOVE A REGENT, WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE, AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF THE MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE REMOVAL OF THE REGENTS, PROVIDED, HOWEVER ANY VACANCIES MAY BE FILLED BY THE BOARD OF REGENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF THE 990 WILL BE SUBMITTED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AT THEIR MARCH 2022 MEETING FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FINALIZATION & FILING. AFTER THE AUDIT COMMITTEE'S APPROVAL, THE 990 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE ENTIRE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR, IN JULY/AUGUST, THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE EMAILS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS TO EACH CURRENT MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS, PRESIDENT'S LEADERSHIP COUNCIL AND PROVOST'S CABINET. FORMS ARE THEN SENT BACK TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE, WHO REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORMS AND TRACKS WHICH FORMS MAY STILL BE OUTSTANDING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, THE BOARD NEGOTIATES THE CONTRACT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNIVERSITY LEGAL COUNSEL. FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES, COMPENSATION IS NEGOTIATED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY WHO CONSULTS WITH THE PERSONNEL OFFICE & COMPARES COMPENSATION WITH PEER INSTITUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE & UPON REQUEST.

ON APRIL 20, 2020, THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED LOAN PROCEEDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4,171,800, UNDER THE PAYCHECK PROTECTION PROGRAM (PPP) AS PART OF THE CARES ACT. THE PROMISSORY NOTES MATURE TWO YEARS FROM THE DATE OF THE FIRST DISBURSEMENT OF THE LOAN AND BEAR INTEREST AT A RATE OF 1.00% PER ANNUM. THE UNIVERSITY USED THE LOAN PROCEEDS FOR PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH THE PPP AND BELIEVES THAT THEY HAVE MET THE CONDITIONS FOR FORGIVENESS OF THE LOAN. IN JUNE 2021, THE LOAN WAS FORGIVEN IN FULL AND A RECOVERY OF $4,171,800 WAS RECORDED IN OTHER REVENUES ON THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2021.

DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2012, CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY ENTERED INTO A LONG-TERM POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT TO PURCHASE THE ENERGY GENERATED BY A SOLAR ELECTRIC GENERATING FACILITY. MANAGEMENT HAS RECOGNIZED A CAPITAL LEASE FOR THE ESTIMATED PAYMENTS RELATED TO THE SYSTEM. ALTHOUGH FOR TAX PURPOSES THE AGREEMENT WOULD NOT FALL UNDER THE DEFINITION OF A CAPITAL LEASE, THE POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT WILL BE ACCOUNTED FOR AS A CAPITAL LEASE ON THE FORM 990 IN KEEPING WITH THE BOOKS AND RECORDS OF THE ORGANIZATION. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2015, AN ADDENDUM WAS CREATED TO INCREASE THE SIZE OF THE SOLAR POWER SYSTEM PREVIOUSLY INSTALLED. THE ADDITIONAL SOLAR POWER INSTALLED UNDER THIS ADDENDUM IS AN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING AGREEMENT AND WILL FOLLOW ALL THE RATES AND TERMS OF THE AGREEMENT.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF 271,113. ROUNDING -3.
THE OVERSIGHT & SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
